list_definition.definition: to (cause to) become better, of higher quality etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: They recently improved the design of that car.

list_ex_of_english: As shown, the rule improves the quality by about 20%.
They have since improved their overall fine-grained score to 66.3%.
In shor t, the use of remote sensing has been a significant tool in improving our archaeological survey methodology.
Each questionnaire was piloted twice, which improved the wording and relevance of the questions.
He rarely could wait weeks or even days until prices improved.
Other potential objectives-such as reduction of environmental impacts or improving the cost-effectiveness of regulations-have been under-emphasized or not attained.
Over the years the relationship between the two improved.
Artificially "controlling" the sun's altitude and azimuth significantly improves discriminating bajo islands from the background areas.
